BREAKING NEWS: 'At least EIGHT people' are killed after gunman storms Texas high school before being taken alive by police

•Shooting took place at 7.45am during art class at Santa Fe High School in Texas
•Law enforcement officials say at least eight people are dead
•Student said she saw a gunman shoot a girl in the leg, prompting lockdown
•Police, sheriff's deputies, ATF agents and a medical helicopter are on the scene
•Gunman was taken into custody at around 9am local time, the school district confirmed
•Students are being transported to another location to reunite with their parents






Medical helicopters are pictured in the parking lot of the suburban Houston school Friday


Students are pictured emptying their backpacks for inspection outside a row of school buses


In this image taken from video a police officer walks near school buses


Students are being transported to another location to reunite with their parents

BREAKING NEWS: 'At least EIGHT people' are killed after gunman storms Texas high school before being taken alive by police

•Shooting took place at 7.45am during art class at Santa Fe High School in Texas
•Law enforcement officials say at least eight people are dead
•Student said she saw a gunman shoot a girl in the leg, prompting lockdown
•Police, sheriff's deputies, ATF agents and a medical helicopter are on the scene
•Gunman was taken into custody at around 9am local time, the school district confirmed
•Students are being transported to another location to reunite with their parents
